name: California Indian Manpower Consortium, Inc. (CIMC)
address: CIMC has seven field offices strategically located throughout the State of California. Specific addresses are not provided in the search results
description: CIMC is a non-profit organization that supports and assists American Indians, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians living in California by offering vocational assessment and training, employment referrals, and other services for economic advancement
services: Alaska-Native-owned Vocational training in California consultation

name: Owens Valley Career Development Center (OVCDC)
description: OVCDC provides educational, vocational, and social service programs to Native Americans in California, focusing on self-sufficiency through education and job readiness. They offer career development and training, including tuition assistance for qualified students attending Cerro Coso Community College
services: Alaska-Native-owned Vocational training in California consultation

name: Northern California Indian Development Council, Inc. (NCIDC)
address: Specific addresses are not provided in the search results, but they serve Indian tribes in the region
description: NCIDC offers programs to assist Native American individuals in reaching their employment goals through the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), providing quality employment and training services

name: California Tribal College

name: Wiyot Tribe

description: The Wiyot Tribe offers vocational training assistance through the BIA-JTP (Bureau of Indian Affairs-Job Training Program) for students accepted or enrolled in skilled job/vocational training programs

name: California Tribal Unilateral Apprenticeship Program (CTUAP)
address: Focuses on the Central Valley of California. Specific addresses are not provided
description: Aims to provide equitable apprenticeship training opportunities leading to job opportunities and increased living wages, with a focus on Native American residents. They have developed apprenticeships in Environmental Science & Protection Technician and Cultural and Conservation Technician
